org.letras.ps.rawdata
Interface IPenAdapter

All Known Implementing Classes:
GenericPenAdapter
public interface IPenAdapter

Pen adapters are used by a pen driver to access the logical pen representation. While the pen manager manages available pens and allows for their retrieval, these pens provide only read access to a pen's data. On the other hand they support all the needed methods for accessing a pens additional capabilities (if applicable).

To maintain a clear separation between the logical access to a pen needed by other parts of the system, write-access in the class pen cannot be allowed. Therefore the pen driver needs to use a pen adapter in order to publish samples etc. of a given pen.

Such a pen adapter is defined by this interface. It allows to set the pen's state and publish its samples, as well as to obtain the unique pen Id in case this is needed by the management application. Which concrete Id this is depends on the implementation and the pen manager component providing this interface.

Version:
0.0.1
Author:
felix_h

Method Detail

publishSample

void publishSample(PenSample sample)
Whenever a pen driver obtains raw data for a given pen, this raw data is published via this method. It takes a PenSample as specified in the IPen processing stage interface.

Typical usage of this method is as follows

  1. set the pen state to DOWN, via a call to penState(IPenState.DOWN)
  2. emit the pen data by publishing RawDataSamples via the publishSample(sample) method
  3. set the pen state to UP, via a call to penState(IPenState.UP)

Parameters:
sample - the PenSample describing an obtained data sample

penId

java.lang.String penId()
Each pen adapter corresponds to a specific pen. This method can be used to obtain the unique Id of this pen and can be used e.g. for management tasks on the driver side.

Returns:
the pen Id of the pen this adapter references

penState

void penState(int state)
Sets the referenced pen into the specified state. Potential states are represented in the IPenState interface. Such states can be
  • OFF: For a turned off pen
  • ON: For a pen that is turned on
  • UP: For a pen which is currently UP, meaning it is not sending data samples
DOWN: For a pen which is currently down, i.e. sending data samples

Parameters:
state - a state as defined in IPenState
